subject: Psychology
title: The Bias Blind Spot
description: A quick win: understand The Bias Blind Spot.

hook.text: You can spot biases in everyone else. Yourself? You're the exception. That's the bias blind spot.

buildup.text: The bias blind spot is the belief that you are less biased than other people.

discovery.text: Studies show that over 85% of people rate themselves as less biased than the average person.

twist.text: Intelligence doesn't help. Smarter people are sometimes better at rationalizing their biases, not avoiding them.

climax.text: Admitting you have blind spots is not weakness â€” it's the prerequisite for any real improvement.

punchline.text: The biggest bias is believing you don't have any.

quiz.question: What is the bias blind spot?
options: Believing you are less biased than others
Being aware of all your biases
